author: Kate Mccann
title: Theresa May will give up her favourite treat for Lent ... crisps
text:
Theresa May will give up her favourite treat for Lent ... crisps The Prime Minister is giving up crisps for lent Credit: Getty Kate McCann , Senior Political Correspondent 28 February 2017 • 5:09pm 
T heresa May is giving up crisps for Lent, Downing Street has revealed. 
A Number 10 spokesman said that the Prime Minister's favourite flavour of the crunchy snack is salt and vinegar, but he declined to state whether she prefers any particular brand. 
He was also unable to say how often Mrs May indulges, telling reporters: "I don't know how many packets of crisps the Prime Minister consumes per week, per day or per month, but she will be giving them up." Theresa May Credit: Bloomberg 
C hristians traditionally deny themselves a favourite treat over the Lent period from Ash Wednesday - which this year falls on March 1 - to Easter Sunday, to mark Jesus's 40 days of fasting in the desert. 
Mrs May has spoken previously of her religious faith and is the daughter of a vicar. 
On becoming Prime Minister she described how her belief in God helps her make difficult decisions. Prime Minister Theresa May and husband Phillip attend Church in her Maidenhead constituency Credit: David Hartley 
S he told the Sunday Times: "I suppose there is something in terms of faith, I am a practising member of the Church of England and so forth, that lies behind what I do. It’s not like I’ve decided to do what I’m going to do and I’m stubborn. 
"I’ll think it through, have a gut instinct, look at the evidence, work through the arguments, because you have to think through the unintended consequences."
